parameter 1: The US video release features the original UK version.
parameter 2: The DVD edition of this series has two hours of material, including the entire final episode, edited out.
parameter 3: The DVD release features the UK version, as well as the Making Of documentary.
parameter 4: The DVD features two extra songs not shown on the VH-1 broadcast.  Scott Stapp performing Riders on the Storm and Ian Astbury Performing Wild Child.
parameter 5: During the original airing and on initial online streaming on Hulu, the song "White Rabbit" played during the climax. The activation of the "Studio 54 Disco Ball" was accompanied by "I Will Survive". Both pieces of music have been replaced by original score on later streams on Hulu and the iTunes version of the episode.
parameter 6: The DVD features two extra songs not shown on the VH-1 broadcast.  Scott Stapp performing Riders on the Storm and Ian Astbury Performing Wild Child.
parameter 7: The Discovery Channel broadcast edits all six episodes into one program, splicing in the documentaries _Triumph of the Beasts (2001) (TV)_ (qv) and _Beasts Within, The (2001) (TV)_ (qv), and is narrated by 'Stockard Channing' (qv). In addition, many scenes of gore and sex have been removed.
parameter 8: The US version from 2004-2006 is heavily edited over the Japanese version. All blood is removed, all guns are changed to non-lethal weapons (pop guns, squirt guns, etc.), all alcohol is changed to juice, and all cigarettes are changed to lollipops, among other changes. When Funimation took over the dub production in 2007, it was a lot more faithful to the original.
parameter 9: During the original airing on the Channel 7 and Prime networks in Australia, all episodes had several scenes cut out. Incidentally, some episodes were never aired at all.
parameter 10: During the original airing and on initial online streaming on Hulu, the song "White Rabbit" played during the climax. The activation of the "Studio 54 Disco Ball" was accompanied by "I Will Survive". Both pieces of music have been replaced by original score on later streams on Hulu and the iTunes version of the episode.
parameter 11: As broadcast, this episode features 15 minutes of material from the previous episode. The original, unscreened version is available on disc 1 of the DVD boxed set (Wim T. Schippers Televisiepraktijken part 2). Alternate footage features Simon attempting to buy a suit with no money (actresses 'Esther Scheldwacht' (qv) and 'Ellen de Thouars' (qv) remain credited in the final version). Other deletions include Nel getting her hair done and buying a new dress and Govert taking snowboarding lessons.
parameter 12: Half hour versions of Vivo airs on NBC LA channel 4 on Saturday late nights following SNL and Apollo.
parameter 13: As broadcast, this episode features 15 minutes of material from the previous episode. The original, unscreened version is available on disc 1 of the DVD boxed set (Wim T. Schippers Televisiepraktijken part 2). Other deletions include Nel getting her hair done and buying a new dress and Govert taking snowboarding lessons.
parameter 14: In the mid-1980s, CBS FOX Video released four Voltron tapes in Australia. Two of those tapes, titled "Voltron In The Castle Of Lions" and "Voltron Versus The Empire Of Drule", had several scenes cut out by the distributor.
parameter 15: The DVD edition of this series has two hours of material, including the entire final episode, edited out.
parameter 16: The U.S 2005 Paramount DVD Print is missing the original intro to THE RESURRECTION that aired on FOX during it's first and second running.
parameter 17: The DVD release features the UK version, as well as the Making Of documentary.

parameter 20: In the mid-1980s, CBS FOX Video released four Voltron tapes in Australia. Two of those tapes, titled "Voltron In The Castle Of Lions" and "Voltron Versus The Empire Of Drule", had several scenes cut out by the distributor.
parameter 21: This episode exists in three versions. As the pilot, it was shot in color (1). However, it was aired on ABC in black & white to match the rest of the first season and ended with previews from upcoming episodes (2). This version was also used in syndication. The DVD release version is similar, but lacks the previews (3). In recent years, the original color version has been aired on cable by the Sci-Fi Channel and the American Life TV Network.
parameter 22: The DVD release features the UK version, as well as the Making Of documentary.
parameter 23: Half hour versions of Vivo airs on NBC LA channel 4 on Saturday late nights following SNL and Apollo.
parameter 24: During the original airing on the Channel 7 and Prime networks in Australia, all episodes had several scenes cut out. Incidentally, some episodes were never aired at all.
parameter 25: In addition to being cut by two minutes each, the syndicated versions have a shorter version of the theme song.
parameter 26: The US version from 2004-2006 is heavily edited over the Japanese version. All blood is removed, all guns are changed to non-lethal weapons (pop guns, squirt guns, etc.), all alcohol is changed to juice, and all cigarettes are changed to lollipops, among other changes. When Funimation took over the dub production in 2007, it was a lot more faithful to the original.
parameter 27: Five different endings were shot, to conceal the identity of the killer up to the final episode. As it aired, it was Alfonsina (Nuria Bages) but in some other reruns of the series, the killer is revealed to be Aura (Beatriz Sheridan) with a completely different motivation for the murder.
parameter 28: The animation of the alien hand taking a hold of Earth that opens every episode in the first season is omitted on the DVDs.

parameter 46: The original UK version, shown on BBC, and the US version, shown on Discovery Channel, differ in various aspects: - Kenneth Branagh does the narration for the UK version, Avery Brooks for the US version - UK version is presented in 6 episodes à 30 minutes, US version is shown as a 3-hour special - US version is cut for gore
